cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses fundamental results on secret sharing schemes based on (conditional) min-entropies, which are commonly studied in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the lower bounds of share sizes, which is a common topic in cryptography (cs.CR). The paper uses techniques from coding theory, which is a subfield of computer science that falls under the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The paper also discusses access structures, which is a topic in security and privacy (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses R\'enyi entropies, which is a topic in mathematical physics and information theory (cs.CC).
